text: Nuclear factor kappa B activates <extra_id_0> proenkephalin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription in T lymphocytes .

text: Upon activation , T lymphocytes accumulate high levels of the neuropeptide enkephalin which correlate with high levels of <extra_id_0> proenkephalin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA in the cells .
Here we investigated the transcriptional basis for these changes .

The <extra_id_0> proenkephalin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter contains a sequence GGGGACGTCCCC , named B2 , which is similar to the kappa B sequence GGGGACTTTCC , the binding site of the transcription factor nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappa B . Activation of T lymphocytes induces an NF-kappa B-like binding activity to the B2 site , concomitant with activation of the <extra_id_0> proenkephalin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .
Mutations at the B2 site abolish this transcriptional activation .

The purified homodimer ( two <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> s ) of the DNA - binding subunit of NF-kappa B binds the B2 site of <extra_id_0> proenkephalin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> relatively better than does the heterotetramer ( two <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> s plus two <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> s ) form of the factor .

text: Thus , it appears that the T-cell - specific activation of the <extra_id_0> proenkephalin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter is mediated by NF-kappa B . However , as NF-kappa B is ubiquitous and the transcriptional activation through the B2 site is T cell specific , yet another T-cell - specific factor which synergizes with NF-kappa B should be considered .
